title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Quizzes An “Always Sunny” star, a celebrated kettle, and arguing almanacs are all part of this week’s news quiz.
Can we talk about the mail, please?
FX By Peter Chianca October 3, 2025 | 5:00 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: ‘That was electric’: Walpole native Cam Schlittler lifts Yankees past Red Sox in Game 3 masterpiece
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Boston Red Sox "We needed to be perfect tonight, because he was perfect.
" Cam Schlittler made history Thursday night in the Bronx.

Frank Franklin II/AP Photo By Trevor Hass October 3, 2025 | 12:00 AM 2 minutes to read A Cohasset kid opened the door for the Yankees in Game 2, and a Walpole kid slammed it shut on the Red Sox in Game 3.

title: Judge: Lawsuit against Boston police who allegedly used excessive force against protesters could go to trial
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “The judge found that if the jury believes that, that would be an unconstitutional policy of the City of Boston.
" Protesters demonstrate Sunday, May 31, 2020, in Boston, over the murder of George Floyd.

title: Red Sox go out with a whimper and other takeaways from season-ending loss to Yankees
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox couldn't solve Yankees rookie Cam Schlittler — who struck out 12 over eight scoreless innings.
It was a rough night both in the field and at the plate for the Red Sox.
(AP Photo/Yuki Iwamura) The Red Sox’ 2025 season came to a disappointing end Thursday night, as Boston fell to the Yankees, 4-0, in a decisive Game 3 of the Wild Card series.

title: 4 plays in a pivotal 4th inning doomed the Red Sox in a 4-0 Yankees Game 3 triumph
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox came close on each one, but they couldn't get an out on any.
Red Sox centerfielder Ceddanne Rafaela can't come up with the catch in the fourth inning Thursday night.
Frank Franklin II/AP Photo Baseball is a game of inches, and in the playoffs, teams on the wrong end of close plays often end up seeing their seasons come to a crashing halt.

title: Pressley joins strikers, protesters at Gaza hunger strike rally
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Participants in the People’s Hunger Strike for Gaza called on Massachusetts senators to introduce anti-bomb legislation.
Hunger strikers and protesters rallied in Boston Wednesday in support of the People's Hunger Strike for Gaza.
Darin Zullo/Boston.

title: 2 Mass. brothers aboard an aid flotilla to Gaza have been detained by Israeli forces: Here’s what we know.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: World News The two Sheffield men were arrested by Israeli forces and taken to Ashdod after their boats were intercepted Wednesday and Thursday.
Two Massachusetts men from the Global Sumud Flotilla have been arrested by Israeli forces.
Saeed Qaq/Getty Images ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Berklee College of Music lays off 70 employees, no faculty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “This is a really hard time.
There’s no getting around it,” President Jim Lucchese wrote to faculty and staff.
Berklee College of Music students.

title: Alex Cora says Brayan Bello, all Red Sox relievers are available to pitch in Game 3 vs. Yankees
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox “Hopefully today we can score a bunch of runs and they keep me out of it.
" Alex Cora said that it will be all hands on deck in Boston's bullpen on Thursday.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Conor Ryan October 2, 2025 | 7:08 PM 2 minutes to read With the Red Sox’ season on the line, Alex Cora said Thursday that it will be all hands on deck in Boston’s bullpen for Game 3 in the Wild Card Series.

title: Patriots DT Milton Williams misses practice with ankle injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams was a limited participant on Wednesday before being downgraded to out on Thursday.

Milton Williams John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe FOXBOROUGH — Patriots defensive tackle Milton Williams did not participate in practice on Wednesday, popping up on the injury report with an ankle injury.
Williams was a limited participant on Wednesday before being downgraded to out on Thursday.
